intro: Pimpinella welwitschii var. buchneri, commonly known as the Namibian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
